overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a practical approach to time-series forecasting focused on handling short data sequences with daily seasonality. The analyst identifies data patterns, evaluates multiple modeling approaches, and ultimately implements a simple averaging method due to data constraints. The process emphasizes robustness over complexity, with thorough consideration of data characteristics and practical implementation details.
common_data_patterns: Complete data blocks without missing values
Negative and positive value ranges (possibly normalized)
key_insights: Prioritization of simple methods (hourly averaging) over complex models (SARIMA/Exponential Smoothing) for short data sequences
Explicit handling of seasonality through hour-of-day grouping
Data rounding to maintain consistency with input precision
Rejection of trend analysis due to insufficient historical data
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with strong practical constraints: Starts with advanced model evaluation but simplifies due to data limitations. Includes detailed data inspection, method comparison, manual calculations, and output formatting considerations.
